title: The controversial origins of the Encyclopedia - Addison Anderson

multiple-choice.question: What was Denis Diderot's initial task when hired by publisher Andr√© le Breton in 1745?

options.label: A
options.text: To write a novel about the French Enlightenment

options.label: B
options.text: To adapt the English cyclopedia for French subscribers

multiple-choice.question: How did Diderot and his co-editor Jean le Rond d'Alembert organize the encyclopedia?

options.label: B
options.text: Using Francis Bacon's "Classification of Knowledge" into a three-part system

options.label: C
options.text: By the importance of each entry

multiple-choice.question: Who wrote a quarter of the encyclopedia, approximately 18,000 articles, without being paid?
Why was the encyclopedia banned by King Louie XV and Pope Clement XIII?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it was written in French

options.label: B
options.text: Because it was considered too long

options.label: C
options.text: Because it challenged the divine right of kings and the authority of the Church

multiple-choice.question: How did Diderot manage to continue publishing the encyclopedia despite the ban?

options.label: A
options.text: He smuggled proofs outside France for publication

options.label: B
options.text: He hid his papers at his own house

options.label: C
options.text: He stopped writing and gave up on the project

options.label: D
options.text: He changed the content to appease the authorities

title: The science of skin color - Angela Koine Flynn

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of melanin in the skin?

options.label: B
options.text: To shield cells from damage caused by UV light

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the pigment that gives rise to a range of brown skin tones, as well as black, brown, and blond hair?
According to the transcript, what was the key to survival for our ancestors in terms of coping with the onslaught of UV light?

options.label: D
options.text: Their own personal sunscreen manufactured beneath the skin: melanin

multiple-choice.question: What is the condition that can occur when humans experience a vitamin D deficiency?
According to the transcript, what is the primary reason why skin color varies across different regions of the world?

options.label: C
options.text: By training with a voice coach

title: Every kid needs a champion - Rita Pierson

multiple-choice.question: According to James Comer, what is necessary for significant learning to occur?
What did the speaker, Ms. Pierson, do when she realized she had taught a lesson incorrectly?

options.label: A
options.text: She ignored the mistake and moved on

options.label: B
options.text: She blamed the students for not understanding

options.label: C
options.text: She apologized to the students for the mistake

options.label: D
options.text: She gave the students extra homework

multiple-choice.question: What was the effect of Ms. Pierson putting a "+2" and a smiley face on a student's paper who had missed 18 out of 20 questions?

options.label: A
options.text: The student felt discouraged and gave up

options.label: B
options.text: The student felt embarrassed and hid the paper

options.label: C
options.text: The student felt encouraged and motivated to do better

options.label: D
options.text: The student didn't care and threw the paper away

multiple-choice.question: According to Ms. Pierson, what is the key to making a difference in a child's life?

options.label: A
options.text: Giving them a lot of homework

options.label: C
options.text: Building a relationship and connection with them

options.label: D
options.text: Ignoring their problems and focusing on academics

multiple-choice.question: What does Ms. Pierson believe every child deserves?

options.label: C
options.text: A champion who will never give up on them

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the mitochondria in a cell?

options.label: C
options.text: To generate energy for the cell

title: How to make your writing funnier - Cheri Steinkellner

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the secret to humor, as said by Aristotle?
What is the Commedia rule for creating comic characters?

options.label: A
options.text: Find the strength, then play it down

options.label: B
options.text: Find the flaw, then play it up

options.label: C
options.text: Find the average, then play it safe

options.label: D
options.text: Find the opposite, then play it cool

options.label: A
options.text: To create a list of jokes

options.label: C
options.text: To find incongruities and generate comedic material

multiple-choice.question: What is the "rule of three" or "zig zig zag" in comedy writing?

options.label: A
options.text: Setting up an expected pattern and then flipping it

options.label: B
options.text: Creating a list of three jokes and then repeating them

options.label: C
options.text: Developing a story with three main characters

options.label: D
options.text: Using three words with a k-sound in a row

title: The immortal cells of Henrietta Lacks - Robin Bulleri

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the HeLa cells in the scientific community?

options.label: A
options.text: They were the first human cells to be grown in a lab.

options.label: B
options.text: They were the first immortal human cell line, allowing for endless duplication.

options.label: C
options.text: They were the first cells to be used in cancer research.

options.label: D
options.text: They were the first cells to be used in genetics research.

multiple-choice.question: Why do normal human cells have a limited number of divisions?

options.label: A
options.text: To prevent the propagation of genetic errors.

options.label: B
options.text: To allow for the growth of new cells.

options.label: C
options.text: To enable the development of diseases.

multiple-choice.question: What was the contribution of HeLa cells to the development of the polio vaccine?

options.label: A
options.text: They provided a source of funding for the research.

options.label: B
options.text: They allowed for the testing of the vaccine on human subjects.

options.label: C
options.text: They enabled the replication of the virus, allowing for vaccine testing.

options.label: D
options.text: They provided a source of inspiration for the researchers.

multiple-choice.question: What is the enzyme that was discovered in HeLa cells, which helps cancer cells evade destruction?
How did HeLa cells contribute to our understanding of cervical cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: They showed that cervical cancer is caused by a genetic mutation.

options.label: B
options.text: They demonstrated that cervical cancer is caused by a virus called HPV.

options.label: C
options.text: They provided a cure for cervical cancer.

options.label: D
options.text: They enabled the development of a vaccine for cervical cancer.

title: #TEDEdChat: A Math Class Makeover | Dan Meyer |

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's main concern about the way math is taught in the US?

options.label: A
options.text: The lack of emphasis on computation skills.

options.label: B
options.text: The over-reliance on textbooks and formulas.

options.label: C
options.text: The failure to promote patient problem-solving and math reasoning.

options.label: D
options.text: The inadequate training of math teachers.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the result of students being taught math in a way that emphasizes formulas and procedures over problem-solving and reasoning?

options.label: A
options.text: They become more confident in their math abilities.

options.label: B
options.text: They develop a strong foundation in math computation.

options.label: C
options.text: They become impatient with problems that don't resolve quickly.

options.label: D
options.text: They learn to apply math to real-world situations.

multiple-choice.question: What approach does the speaker suggest for teaching math in a way that promotes patient problem-solving and math reasoning?

options.label: A
options.text: Breaking down complex problems into simpler ones.

options.label: B
options.text: Providing students with clear instructions and formulas.

options.label: C
options.text: Encouraging students to develop their own problem-solving strategies.

options.label: D
options.text: Using multimedia resources to bring real-world problems into the classroom.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of using real-world problems and multimedia resources in math education, according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes math more enjoyable and engaging.

options.label: B
options.text: It helps students develop a stronger foundation in math computation.

options.label: C
options.text: It allows students to apply math to real-world situations.

options.label: D
options.text: It creates a level playing field for students of different skill levels.

multiple-choice.question: Why does the speaker believe that now is an amazing time to be a math teacher?

options.label: A
options.text: Because there are more resources available for math education.

options.label: B
options.text: Because there is a greater emphasis on math education in schools.

options.label: C
options.text: Because technology has made it easier to create and distribute high-quality math curriculum.

options.label: D
options.text: Because there is a greater need for math teachers in the workforce.

title: Why certain wildfires are necessary - Jim Schulz

Which type of tree cone requires an environmental trigger to release its seeds?
What is the primary reason why lodgepole pine seeds have difficulty germinating in the shade of their parent trees?
What is the purpose of intentionally starting controlled burns in fire-dependent forests?

options.label: A
options.text: To promote the growth of new trees

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce fuels and prevent catastrophic blazes

options.label: C
options.text: To create a more diverse ecosystem

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the population of forest animals

title: Can you solve the temple riddle? - Dennis E. Shasha

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem that the expedition team faces in the ancient temple?

options.label: A
options.text: They have to find the hidden treasure before the temple collapses.

options.label: B
options.text: They have to navigate through a maze to reach the exit.

options.label: C
options.text: Two of the students have been cursed by the altar's curse and may lie about the path to the exit.

options.label: D
options.text: They have to solve a puzzle to unlock the door to the exit.

multiple-choice.question: How does the team leader plan to ensure that everyone escapes the temple?

options.label: A
options.text: By sending one person to explore each of the four halls ahead.

options.label: B
options.text: By splitting the students into groups of four to explore two of the paths.

options.label: C
options.text: By exploring one of the halls alone and splitting the remaining students into one pair and two trios.

options.label: D
options.text: By following the trail markings that they made on the way in.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reasoning behind the team leader's plan to split the students into one pair and two trios?

options.label: A
options.text: So that each group can explore a different path and report back to the team leader.

options.label: B
options.text: So that the possessed students will be in the same group and can be easily identified.

options.label: C
options.text: So that the team leader can use the process of elimination to figure out which path is the correct one.

options.label: D
options.text: So that the majority of students in each group will be truthful and can be trusted.

multiple-choice.question: What happens if a trio returns to the hall in total agreement about the path they explored?

options.label: A
options.text: The team leader knows that one of them is lying.

options.label: B
options.text: The team leader knows that none of them are lying.

options.label: C
options.text: The team leader has to guess who to trust.

options.label: D
options.text: The team leader sends them to explore another path.

multiple-choice.question: How does the team leader ultimately figure out which path is the correct one?

options.label: A
options.text: By trusting the majority of students in each group.

options.label: B
options.text: By using the process of elimination to eliminate the incorrect paths.

options.label: C
options.text: By following the trail markings that they made on the way in.

options.label: D
options.text: By sending one person to explore each of the four halls ahead.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: It is only accessible to experts in the field

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: B

title: When will the next mass extinction occur? - Borths, D'Emic, and Pritchard

multiple-choice.question: What event occurred about 66 million years ago that had a devastating impact on life on Earth?

options.label: A
options.text: A massive earthquake struck the Earth.

options.label: B
options.text: A massive volcanic eruption filled the atmosphere with carbon dioxide and an asteroid struck the Earth.

options.label: C
options.text: The Earth's oceans became too acidic to support life.

options.label: D
options.text: The Earth's atmosphere became too cold to support life.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe a rapid change in the environment that causes thousands of species to die off in a geological instant?
What was the largest mass extinction event in Earth's history, occurring 252 million years ago?

options.label: B
options.text: The extinction of 95% of species in the ocean and on land

options.label: C
options.text: The extinction of giant ground sloths and mammoths

multiple-choice.question: What is believed to have contributed to the extinction of large mammals such as giant ground sloths and mammoths?

options.label: A
options.text: Changes in the climate and ecosystem due to the melting ice caps

options.label: B
options.text: The rise of a certain hominid species originating in Africa

options.label: C
options.text: A combination of both A and B

multiple-choice.question: According to studies, what is the current rate of extinction compared to the normal background rate?

options.label: A
options.text: The same as the normal background rate

options.label: B
options.text: Hundreds to thousands of times higher than the normal background rate

options.label: C
options.text: Lower than the normal background rate
